data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Incandescent Compatible Dimmer Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Incandescent Compatible Dimmer Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Incandescent Compatible Dimmer Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Incandescent Compatible Dimmer Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Best dimmers on the market! Smooth and super easy to use. No flickering. I love them!
1#Slim dimmers. I have 4 dimmers in one box. Regular size dimmers did not fit- but Love these slimmer dimmers…. They all fit very nicely..
2#Slim led dimmer. Compact, work great with led recessed lights, no flickering
3#Poor choice. Worst dimmers Every one flickering And one falling
4#Arrived unusable. Right out of the box, only one in six worked, the other 5 caused our lights to flicker. We replaced them with higher quality dimmer switches and now no flickering. Would not recommend
5#A little tricky to install, but they work well. Not the simplest install but they work well. Make sure you adjust the dimmer with the tiny side switch after installing as it is hidden once the cover plate is replaced.
6#faulty switches. Half of the switches flicker.
7#Severe flashing. Installed 5 of these dimmers, each with no more than 35 watts led . After just a couple weeks use, two of them began to flash.
8#Work great. Installed these all over my house and they work great. price is great, home depot has 1 for 26 dollars.
9#3 out of 12 have failed in less than 3 months. I think Amazon should take this product down. Lights start blinking at different brightness settings. 3 out of 12 failed in 3 months. It must be cheap components.
10#worked great for almost 2 weeks. dimmer stopped working with 2 small led bulbs. the dimmers were great until they weren't
11#they flicker and can't adjust. terrible quality. I replaced with another better known company
12#There were 6 switches, only 3 are working. Other 3 are broken. Half of the switches are broken
13#Just as good as $30 ones! Excellent dimmer…adjuster is flawless. Saved $20 per item compared to name brand.
14#good quality. easy to install
15#Easy Install. Nice looking works great.
16#Function well. It’s east to install and it’s functioning well
17#garbage, you get what you pay for. two of them burnt out already, you get what you pay for, waste of money
18#Low cost for low quality. All six were faulty. Flickering, inconsistent energy flow, lights cutting on and off. You get what you pay for.
19#Best Deal. Overall this is a good deal for a pack of dimmer switches that work as good as any I have used. Installation seemed standard, dimmer switches are always tighter than a regular switch and these compare to any other dimmer switch. There is an internal knob that allows you to adjust the brightness of the actual dimmer so the switch does not go too dim to the point that the light turns off. This is not my favorite style switch because it doesn’t quite match the standard toggle or rocker switch, but it works great and is the best deal I found at the time.
20#Works well. Works well. Still have some problems with turning on the light when it’s in a low dim setting but that could be because of the lightbulbs that we have in the chandelier.
21#Perfect dimmer switch. Love the option to use dimmer feature. Excellent light switches.
22#Could be a faulty box but I did not like them. Did not work properly once installed. Had my recessed lighting fixtures flickering in between high and low
23#Prone to Light Flickering. I love the thinness of these dimmers. They fit nicely in crowded electrical boxes and have light intensity settings to control how much to dim. Unfortunately, 4 out of the 12 I have caused severe light flickering and had to replace them. For that reason, I can't give more than 2 stars.
24#Non satisfaite. Je suis très déçu du résultat mes lumières scintilles toujours lorsque je baisse l’intensité. Je peux à peine baisser pour avoir une lumière constante. D’une fois à l’autre c’est jamais pareille
25#Lights don't flicker when switch turned on. Needed a dimmer that would fit in a shallow box. Limited choice of dimmers available and some LED lights flicker using other brands. This dimmer works well.
26#Déconseille / I will never recommend. Après un mois d'utilisation, 10 de mes 12 interrupteurs sont défectueux ou non fonctionnel.
27#Les lumières scintillent sur les 3 voies. Le produit est bon sauf pour les 3 voies, les lumières scintillent lorsque l'on diminue l'intensité au plus bas..
28#Works well. Easy install, works well so far
29#Fragil. Fragile don’t short them
30#Might work well with incandescent but not with LED. Might work well with incandescent but not with LED
31#Garbage. 2 of the 6 didn’t work. Amazon offered a $15 credit
32#Great for the price. They were easy to install. Put in 12 of them and no problems. When they flickered there was an adjustment, and voila no flickering.
33#Very poor - only useable as on/off. You get what you pay for. Dim range is non existant, lites flicker, they don't really dim. Tried on multiple rooms / bulbs. Got Leviton and they work as expected. Full dim range, no flicker.
